page.title: 05WALKS AROUND OAKAMOOR
page.content: Walking is one of the main attractions of the area,both for local people and for visitors,and a maze of pathways presents many alternative routes.The Youth Hostel on the Ranger provides a stopping place for the more serious long-distance walker, perhaps walking the Staffordshire Way which passes close by. Dimmingsdale is a favourite haunt for an afternoon stroll, either along the Earl's Drive, below wooded slopes and beside the stream and ponds;or climbing higher through conifers and by rocky outcrops topped by Scots Pines,with views over treetops and side valleys. The Ramblers Retreat provides a welcome rest and refreshment. The disused railway line makes an ideal walk following the course of the main valley beside the River Churnet.
